_header: The beastly lust the furious appetite
_description: William Dunbar, ‘Ballate aganis Evill Women’, attributed to William Dunbar — six stanzas rhyme royal

CULLl510.First Lines:
The beistlie lust þe furious appatiteThe haistie wo þe
                    verrie grit defame…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…Why women hense gois quyt now for euirQuhilk sould caus men
                    fra subtill huris dissiuir
CULLl510.Editions:
Small,  John, Ae. James George Mackay,  George Powell McNeill,   and  Walter Gregor, eds.  
             The Poems of William Dunbar.
             5 pts. 
             Scottish Text Society
         2, 4, 16, 21, 29. Edinburgh, 1884-93: 2.266-7.

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
The Beistlie lust þe furious appetyteThe haistie wo þe
                    verie grit defame…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…With women haill gois quyt now for euirQuhilk sould caus men
                    frome subtill huris dissivir

Banna.First Lines:
The beistly lust the furius appetytThe haisty wo The verry grit
                    defame…
Banna.Last Lines:
…With wemen evill It gois all quyt for evirQuhilk sowld ws
                    lerne ffra subteill huris dissevir
Banna.Facsimiles:
Fox,  Denton,  and  William A. Ringler.  
             The Bannatyne Manuscript: National Library of Scotland Advocates’
                MS. 1.1.6
         London: Scolar Press, in Association with The National Library of
            Scotland, 1980.
